source_sentence: 緣生初勝分法本經卷上
translation: First Sutra on the Primacy of the Dharma Born from Conditions, Volume 1

source_sentence: 隋天竺三藏達磨笈多譯
translation: Sui Translation of the Tianzang Tripiṭaka Dharmagupta

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時婆伽婆在舍囉婆悉帝城勝林給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Bhagavān was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時眾多比丘集坐住堂，作是議論言：「諸命者等，世尊曾以無量諸門，說十二分緣生，於彼最初演說無明以為緣體。
translation: At the time, a large group of monks gathered in the meditation hall and had this discussion, saying, "Gentlemen, the Bhagavān has explained the 12 factors of dependent arising in measureless ways, and he first explained nescience as the perceptual object.

source_sentence: 有何因緣，一切煩惱諸行緣中，惟說無明以為緣體？
translation: What are the causes and conditions that make nescience the only conditioned entity among the conditions of all the afflictions and conditioned activities?
What is the difference between this nescient view and this ignorant view?"

source_sentence: 是諸比丘集坐住堂議論未竟。
translation: The monks then gathered in the abbot's hall before finishing their discourse.

source_sentence: 世尊晝日遊於定行，以天耳清淨過人，聞其議論，於日後分從定行起，詣彼住堂，到已在比丘眾前，於常所設座上坐。
translation: After ascending to the meditation hall during the day, the Bhagavān, who has a divine ear that's superior to that of other people, heard their discussion, got up from his meditation practice after sunset, went to the meditation hall, and when he arrived, he sat down on the seat that was always set aside for him in front of the monks.

source_sentence: 坐訖，世尊告諸比丘言：「比丘！
translation: After he finished sitting, the Bhagavān addressed the monks, saying, "Monks!

source_sentence: 何故集坐住堂議論未竟，有何議論於此集坐？」
translation: Why is there a discussion here in the assembly hall before the discussion is finished?"
The monks said, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 此眾多比丘集坐在堂作是議論言：『諸命者等，世尊曾以無量諸門，說十二分緣生，於彼最初演說無明以為緣體。
translation: This large group of monks sat in the meditation hall and had this discussion, saying, "Gentlemen, the Bhagavān has explained the 12 factors of dependent arising in measureless ways, and he first explained nescience as the perceptual object.

source_sentence: 有何因緣，一切煩惱諸行緣中，惟說無明以為緣體？
translation: What are the causes and conditions that make nescience the only conditioned entity among the conditioned activities of all the afflictions?'
What is the difference between this nescient view and this ignorant view?'
Great virtue!

source_sentence: 我等眾多比丘集坐住堂議論未竟，有如是議於此集坐。」
translation: Before we had finished our discussion, a large group of monks gathered here in the meditation hall had this discussion."

source_sentence: 如是語已，世尊告諸比丘：「有法門名緣生初勝分，善聽善思，當為汝說。
translation: After speaking thus, the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "There's a dharma-gate called the first superior aspect of dependent arising that's well heard and well considered, and I will explain it for you.
What's the dharma-gate of the first superior aspect of dependent arising?
bhikṣus!

source_sentence: 有十一種勝異中勝異故，安立無明為緣生初緣。
translation: Because there are eleven distinctive differences, nescience is posited as a condition for producing the first condition.
What are the eleven?

source_sentence: 所謂攀緣勝異、種相勝異、由緒勝異、等起勝異、轉生勝異、顛倒勝異、相勝異、業勝異、障礙勝異、順縛勝異、對治勝異。」
translation: These are the superiority of attachments, the superiority of characteristics, the superiority of causes, the superiority of equal production, the superiority of transmigration, the superiority of mistakenness, the superiority of characteristics, the superiority of actions, the superiority of obstacles, the superiority of compliant bonds, and the superiority of antidotes."

source_sentence: 爾時有異比丘，即從坐起整衣一髆，向世尊所合掌曲躬，白言：「大德！
translation: It was then that a different monk rose from his seat, adjusted his robe and broad-shouldered, bowed with his palms together to the Bhagavān, and said, "Mañjuśrī!
What is the difference between the superiority of nescience in climbing to objects?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 因果俱過惡一切染分因果、俱功德一切淨分，並為無明之所攀緣。
translation: The cause and effect are both the cause and effect of all the defiled parts of transgressions and all the pure parts of merits, and they are the object of nescience.
Monks!
This is the superiority of nescience as an object of contemplation."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!
What are the varieties of nescience that are superior?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!
Covered by the truth, it appears untrue.
Monks!
This is the difference between the superiority of the varieties of nescience."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!
What is the difference between the causes of nescience and those of readiness?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 於一切煩惱染、業染、生染而作由緒根本住處故。」
translation: It's because the basic abode of readiness is created by defilement of all afflictions, defilement of actions, and defilement of birth."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!
What is defilement by all afflictions?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 略說三種煩惱，一切煩惱染，所謂無慧煩惱、疑慧煩惱、邪慧煩惱。」
translation: Briefly, I'll explain the three kinds of afflictions that defile all afflictions, which are called the affliction of no wisdom, the affliction of doubtful wisdom, and the affliction of mistaken wisdom."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!
What is all defiled activity?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 略說自相三種差別(謂身口意也)及障礙對治相三種差別(障礙者非福也，對治者福及不動也)，總攝業染。」
translation: It briefly describes three kinds of distinctions in their own characteristics (which are the physical, verbal, and mental) and three kinds of distinctions in the characteristics of hindrances and antidotes (hindrances are not good qualities, and antidotes are good qualities and immovable qualities) that collectively include defiled karma."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!
What are all the various defilements that arise?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 略說三受依止，所謂苦受、樂受、不苦不樂受；三種苦故，所謂苦苦、壞苦、行苦，總攝生染。」
translation: It briefly describes the three bases of sensation, which are painful sensation, pleasant sensation, and neither painful nor pleasant sensation, and the three kinds of suffering, which are called painful, painful, painful, and painful action, and which collectively produce defilement."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 云何此一切種煩惱染、業染、生染，皆以無明而作由緒根本住處？」
translation: How are all these defilements of affliction, defilements of action, and defilements of birth caused by ignorance and their fundamental abodes?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 於實諦中二種愚故，未生煩惱染而令其生，若已生者漸大增多；未生業染而令其生，若已生者復隨積集；未生生染而令其生，若已生者不可移轉。
translation: In the true truth, due to two kinds of folly, afflictive defilements that have yet to arise will cause them to arise, and if they have already arisen, they will gradually increase; karmic defilements that have yet to arise will cause them to arise, and if they have already arisen, they will accumulate; and defilements that have yet to arise will cause them to arise, and if they have already arisen, they are irreversible.

source_sentence: 是故說言一切種煩惱染、業染、生染，皆以無明而作由緒根本住處。
translation: That's why it's said that all kinds of afflictive defilements, karmic defilements, and birth defilements are caused by ignorance and have their basic abodes.
Monks!
This is the reason nescience is so different."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!
What is the difference between nescience and equality of birth?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 此無明於來世苦諦所攝更生之身，愚惑不了，於現在苦諦所攝已得之身，亦愚惑不了，由此愚惑故，攝聚緣生及轉出緣生，和合攝聚、和合轉出，此二種緣生及來世、現在二身愚惑，皆以無明為等起之緣。」
translation: This ignorance prevents delusion in the body that's regenerated in the future life when it's included in the truth of suffering, and it prevents delusion in the body that's acquired in the present when it's included in the truth of suffering; as a result of this delusion, conditions arise for gathering and formation, conditions arise for turning out, conditions arise for gathering in combination, and conditions arise for turning out in combination; these two kinds of conditions arise, and delusion in the two bodies of the future and present are all conditioned by ignorance."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 何者攝聚緣生和合攝聚？」
translation: What are the gathering clusters, the conditions for their arising, and the combinations that gather clusters?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 初無明緣行，行緣識，如是名色、六入、觸緣受，是名攝聚緣生和合攝聚。」
translation: The first condition of nescience is conditioned by form, and form is conditioned by consciousness; thus, name-and-form, the six sense-fields, and touch are conditioned by sensation, which is called the mass that collects, causes birth, and combines to collect."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 何者轉出緣生和合轉出？」
translation: What is the turning out of dependency, the coming together, and the turning out?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 第二無明緣中，受緣愛，愛緣取，如是有緣生，乃至生緣老死，是名轉出緣生和合轉出。」
translation: The second condition of nescience, in which feeling conditioned by craving and craving conditioned by grasping, and thus there are conditions for birth up to birth conditioned by old age and death, is called turning out conditions for birth and combination and turning out."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 云何初無明於彼攝聚緣生和合攝聚而作起緣？」
translation: How does the first ignorance cause the formation of a compounded compound by combining the compounded and the conditioned arising from that compounded condition?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 此一於更生身，愚惑不了求於更生，以此愚惑求更生故，於更生中見其好事。
translation: "Regarding this reborn body, this foolish confusion doesn't allow them to pursue reborn, and because of this foolish confusion they pursue reborn, they see good things in reborn.

source_sentence: 然於現在愛不愛境，由執著分別故，作非福行，所謂於眾具生貪，於損惱生瞋相應故，則於好惡不持思量，便作放逸迷惑之行，他世惡事思念而不覺知，是故彼非福行無明作緣。
translation: However, because of their attachment to and discrimination of what they like and don't like in the present, they engage in what's not good conduct, which is described as craving for the necessities and the concomitance of anger toward the detriments, then they don't contemplate the good and the bad, and they engage in careless and deluded behavior and don't perceive the contemplation of bad things in other lives.

source_sentence: 若復於更生中或見好事，或見出道，乃作福行及不動行，或因說法覺知，或自修習靜念，彼覺念中雖有善心而非正思，彼以此故，則為更生迷惑之所牽引。
translation: If someone also sees good things in their rebirth or sees the way out, then they engage in meritorious and immovable behavior, or if they perceive the teaching as a result of it or cultivate quiet mindfulness on their own, then although they perceive mindfulness with good thoughts but not correct thinking, they'll be led by the delusion of their rebirth as a result.

source_sentence: 所謂於更生中見其好事，不怯弱故，見其出道，不怯弱故，彼福非福不動行，惡對對治相等，六識身中共生共滅，則於現在報識生滅之中，安置彼等諸行熏習後新出生所有種子，攝取相應故。
translation: That is, when they see something good in their rebirth and aren't fainthearted, when they see their escape from the path and aren't fainthearted, when their meritorious and non-meritorious immovable actions are equal in opposing and counteracting evil, and when the six consciousnesses are co-arisen and co-cessated, they place all the newly born seeds that are perfumed by these actions in the midst of the arising and ceasing of the present reward consciousness, and they are collected and associated with them.

source_sentence: 所有種子既皆攝取，後若出生則有次第，謂攝名色、六入、觸等，漸當出生彼名色等於此現在報識之中，且生因相未是果相，是故說名攝聚緣生。
translation: Since all of those seeds are collected, there's a sequence of birth that involves collecting name-and-form, the six sense-fields, and touch, which will gradually produce name-and-form and so forth in the present reward consciousness and produce a causal aspect that's not yet an effect, which is why it's called collecting clusters of conditions for birth.
Monks!

source_sentence: 此是第一無明於攝聚緣生和合攝聚而作起緣。」
translation: This is the first nescience that creates conditions for gathering clusters of conditions and combining them with gathering clusters."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 云何後無明於彼轉出緣生和合轉出而作起緣？」
translation: How does late-stage nescience combine with the causes and conditions that arise in the context of those causes and conditions that arise in the context of those causes and conditions?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 此一於現在身所起迷惑，以六入、觸作緣生受，即得其味。
translation: This is the delusion that arises in the present body, which gives rise to sensations using the six sense-fields and contact as conditions, and that's when its taste is obtained.

source_sentence: 以得味故，當來還求此類之受。
translation: Because they've obtained their taste, they'll seek this kind of sensation in the future.

source_sentence: 有所求時便起於取，於樂受中渴愛作緣則生欲取，言欲取者分別欲故。
translation: When there's something to seek, then grasping arises, and within pleasant sensations, craving as a condition gives rise to grasping for desire, which is called grasping for desire because of discriminated desires.

source_sentence: 彼為先首方有欲界煩惱，若復新受為緣，則生無有渴愛共厭離行，此與厭離相應未為道理，彼依渴愛，以非方便求無有時，則有出離邪見、決定邪見及彼二依止邪見(依亦有二，合為四種)，由彼令此渴愛緣取。
translation: When they are the first to experience the afflictions of the desire realm, then if new sensations are the condition, then there will be a lack of thirst and a shared practice of disillusionment, which is not yet reasonably associated with disillusionment, and when they rely on thirst and seek nothing by other means, then there will be mistaken views of emancipation, mistaken views of certainty, and those two mistaken views of reliance (there are also two kinds of reliance, which are combined into four), which cause this thirst to condition apprehension.

source_sentence: 若復彼取為依，未得離欲，如是死時，然此四見及欲界煩惱，以欲渴愛作緣生取，若復離欲離色，彼色界渴愛、無色界渴愛生得常有。
translation: If those attachments are the basis and they haven't yet become free of desire, then when they die like this, these four views and the afflictions of the desire realm will create attachments based on desire and thirst, and if they again become free of desire and free of form, then thirst in the form realm and thirst in the formless realm will arise and become permanent.

source_sentence: 若色界、無色界中煩惱生時，色界、無色界便起於取。
translation: When afflictions arise in the form and formless realms, then apprehension arises in the form and formless realms.

source_sentence: 彼色、無色界煩惱及此諸見，或以色界渴愛作緣生取，或以無色界渴愛作緣生取。
translation: Those afflictions and views in the form and formless realms either cause craving in the form realm to give rise to grasping, or they cause craving in the formless realm to give rise to grasping.

source_sentence: 如是渴愛緣取故，已得諸行熏習報識共取而生。
translation: Because of this craving as a condition for apprehension, the acquired karmic impressions of the reward consciousness are co-acquired and produced.

source_sentence: 彼取攝已，先所集行所有所有渴愛未滅，彼處彼處則當現前，為令自身轉出故。
translation: After those grasping are included, there's a previously accumulated conditioned thirst that's yet to cease, and that place and that condition will then manifest itself in order to cause its own transformation out of existence.

source_sentence: 以是因緣有於出生，故說彼行為有，彼取力故。
translation: Because this is the cause and condition for their birth, it's said that those formations are existent because of the power of their grasping.

source_sentence: 行既為有，於此死已先所攝聚，當出生者作緣轉出，是故說名有緣生。
translation: Since the conditioned condition is existent, the cluster that was previously collected after death will be the cause for birth to occur, which is why it's called conditioned birth.

source_sentence: 於轉出中，出生時相壞異於昔，復至彼邊則有死退壽命終盡，是故說名生緣老死。
translation: When it's produced, its appearance at birth is different from that of the past, and when it comes to the other side, there's death and regression, and its life span is ended; therefore, it's called birth conditioned by old age and death.
Monks!

source_sentence: 此是第二無明，於轉出緣生和合轉出而作起緣。」
translation: This is the second nescience that combines the causes and conditions of turning out with the causes and conditions of turning in."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 何故轉出緣生中渴、取二種，而不說為諸行緣也？」
translation: Why are the two kinds of craving and grasping in conditioned arising turned out and not explained as conditions for conditioned actions?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!
Thirst and grasping are eliminated in their own right because they are part of the same realm.

source_sentence: 如欲渴及取，不應作色界、無色界不動行緣，非境界故。
translation: Desiring thirst and apprehending should not be the condition of immovable action in the form and formless realms, but not the objective realm.

source_sentence: 如欲渴於不動行中，如是，色渴於無色界中、無色渴於欲界色界中、色渴於欲界中，亦爾。」
translation: If one wants to crave in immovable action, thus it's likewise for form to crave in the formless realm, formless craving in the form realm of the desire realm, and form to crave in the desire realm."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 何故欲渴及取，不與福非福行為緣？」
translation: Why are desire, thirst, and grasping not contingent on beneficial and non-beneficial actions?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 於此現前所有境界，愛與不愛而為增上，以有欲渴起不善根作非福行。
translation: In all these present realms, craving and non-craving are intensified, and with desire and thirst unwholesome roots are created that result in unwholesome actions.

source_sentence: 由於共因果非福行中不知其惡故，所謂心惡及所作惡，以不知故起非福行。
translation: Because they don't know the evils in the unwholesome actions that are the result of common causes, they're called evils of mind and the evils they create, which give rise to unwholesome actions because they don't know them.

source_sentence: 而彼心及所作惡等，惟以無明為緣，非渴為緣，與不善根不共境界故。
translation: That mind and the evil it does are only conditioned by ignorance, not by thirst, and are therefore not in common with the realm of unwholesome roots.

source_sentence: 若以欲渴作於福行，依信乃作，謂信死必生、生必藉緣，以信攝故所有渴取，我但施設為障覆無記，若法障覆無記則不能起行。
translation: If someone wants to perform meritorious actions based on thirst, they perform them based on faith, which is the belief that death will surely give rise to birth and birth will surely be by means of conditions, and all thirst and grasping are included because of faith, which I simply define as hindering indeterminacy, and if things hinder indeterminacy, then the actions can't arise.

source_sentence: 由於共因果福行中不知出離故，求可愛生便作福行，是故雖云福行，亦以無明為緣。」
translation: Because they don't know liberation from the meritorious actions that share common causes and effects, they then engage in meritorious actions by seeking desirable births; therefore, even though they are called meritorious actions, they are conditioned by ignorance."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 何故色界渴取，不與色界不動行為緣？」
translation: Why is thirst-acquisition in the form realm not a condition for immovable action in the form realm?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 未離欲者，色渴未生未得住處；彼未有時未得住處故，不能為色界不動行緣，令其得起。
translation: "When someone isn't free of desire, their thirst for form has yet to arise and has yet to attain a dwelling place; because they haven't yet attained a dwelling place, they can't cause immovable action in the form realm to arise as a condition for it.

source_sentence: 如色界渴於色界不動行中，如是無色界渴於無色界不動行中亦爾。
translation: As thirst in the form realm is present in the immovable action of the form realm, so is thirst in the formless realm present in the immovable action of the formless realm.

source_sentence: 由於色界身、無色界身有過惡中見其好事，想而思惟，或因說法，或因教授法故，有此不正思惟，與彼行為緣。
translation: Because they see something good in the form realm body or the formless realm body in the midst of something wrong and bad, they conceptualize and contemplate it, either as a result of teaching or teaching the Dharma, and have this incorrect contemplation as a condition for their conditioned actions.

source_sentence: 然此不正思惟，為無明所引，不正思惟果，共無明和合，與不動行為緣故，是故彼不動行，亦以無明為緣，應知。
translation: However, this incorrect contemplation is led by ignorance, and the fruit of incorrect contemplation, which combines with ignorance, is the condition for immovable action; therefore, that immovable action also has ignorance as its condition, you should know.
Monks!

source_sentence: 又一無有渴為依故，作諸福行及不動行，由無有渴故，則見諸有過惡，何肯更求當有？
translation: Once again, because there's no thirst as a basis, one does meritorious and immovable actions, and because there's no thirst, then one sees all the faults and evils that exist, so why would one want to have what should exist?

source_sentence: 然復於無有中不如實知，以不如實知又未得對治道故，迷非對治為對治想，便作福行及不動行。
translation: Still, because they don't truly know that there's nothing, and because they haven't attained the corrective path because they don't truly know it, they are deluded in thinking that what's not corrective is corrective, and then they engage in meritorious and immovable behavior.
Monks!

source_sentence: 以此因緣，應知惟以無明緣行，非渴、取為緣。」
translation: By these causes and conditions, you should know that nescience alone is the condition for action, not thirst or craving."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若行於六識身中和合共生者，何故說言行緣於識？」
translation: If conditioned formations are produced in conjunction with the six consciousnesses in the body, why is it said that conditioned formations are produced by the consciousnesses?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 此六識身中福非福不動等行，和合共生共滅，即於果報識中安置諸行熏習，於後新異出生報識作引方便，是故說言行緣於識。」
translation: These six consciousnesses contain both meritorious and non-meritorious immovable actions that combine to produce and extinguish together, which places the perfuming of actions in the resultant consciousness and serves as a guide for new, subsequently produced resultant consciousnesses; therefore, it's said that actions are conditioned by consciousness."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 名色、六入、觸、受諸分，於識中同時攝聚種子，何故說時隨次第說？」
translation: The components of name and form, the six sense-fields, touch, and sensation are all collected together in consciousness as seeds, so why is it explained in sequential order when it's explained?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!
It's because they'll be produced in successive stages in the future."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 何故說名色、六入、觸、受等為禪磨，義翻為生，謂一報未死已前總名，非初受生？」
translation: Why is it said that name-and-form, the six sense-fields, touch, sensation, and so forth are meditation and māra, which is the general term for the first retribution before death and not the first sensation of birth?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 共因受用依止，及共因受用故。」
translation: It's because of the support of shared causal enjoyment and shared causal enjoyment."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若惟名生無色，當有何過？」
translation: If only names give rise to formlessness, what fault will there be?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 若名不住色中者，禪磨續轉，則不相應。」
translation: If someone is called someone who doesn't dwell in form, the continual activity of meditation isn't associated with it."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若惟色生無名，當有何過？」
translation: If only form arises without a name, what fault should there be?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 色若不與名合，不被攝持，則當壞失不得增長。」
translation: If form doesn't coincide with words and isn't collected, it will be destroyed and won't grow."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若惟識緣六入，當有何過？」
translation: If consciousness is the only condition for the six sense-fields, what fault should there be?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 於其始時未滿六入，惟有身根及以意根，其所轉生未可得有。
translation: At the beginning, when the six sense-fields are not yet complete, there are only the physical faculty and the mental faculty, and their birth in transition is not yet possible.

source_sentence: 此兩根體，其惟名色在於初時，以為次第與彼六入滿足為緣，是故說言名色緣六入。」
translation: Of these two faculties, only name-and-form was present at the beginning, and in order they fulfilled the six sense-fields as a condition, which is why it's called the condition of name-and-form for the six sense-fields."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若惟六入滿足則是禪磨究竟，何故復說觸及受也？」
translation: If only the fulfillment of the six sense-fields were the ultimate meditation, why is it again explained as touch and sensation?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 此六入禪磨究竟者，是受用依止究竟而未受用，必受用究竟者，乃是共因領受，是故受用依止究竟及受用究竟，得名禪磨究竟，應知。」
translation: These six final stages of meditation are the final stages of the apprehension of the basis of functioning but not yet functioning, and the final stages of functioning are the shared causal apprehension; therefore, the final stages of the apprehension of the basis of functioning and the final stages of the apprehension of functioning are called the final stages of meditation, as you should know."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 此以無明緣渴，亦說受緣；若惟無明緣渴不以受緣，當有何過？」
translation: This is called thirst by the condition of nescience, and it's also called the condition of sensation; if thirst is only the condition of nescience but not the condition of sensation, what would be wrong with that?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 三種渴、三種有，一時轉生故，然以受緣渴故，相待為力則不轉生，是故不惟無明緣渴。」
translation: The three kinds of thirst and the three kinds of existence are produced at one time, but because thirst is the condition for feeling, mutual dependence is the force that doesn't produce them; therefore, it's not only thirst that's the condition for ignorance."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若惟受緣於渴，當有何過？」
translation: If we only experience the condition of thirst, what fault will there be?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 一切諸渴皆以受為緣，然復有受非是渴緣，乃與諸渴而作滅緣，是故不惟受緣於渴。」
translation: All thirst is conditioned by sensation, but then there's sensation that's not a condition of thirst but a condition of the cessation of thirst; therefore, it's not only sensation that's a condition of thirst."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若惟渴緣於有，不以取緣，當有何過？」
translation: If someone only longs for the condition of existence and doesn't take it as an object, what's wrong with that?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 渴名為求，於彼惡趣必無求者，然作非福之行，雖求善趣恒與相違，果轉生時非渴為緣，自以取緣令其轉生。
translation: Thirst is called seeking, and surely there's no seeker in that bad destiny, yet he does what's not good, even though it's contrary to seeking a good destiny, and when he's fruitfully reborn, it's not thirst that's the cause, but he causes it to be reborn by taking the cause himself.

source_sentence: 比丘所云無有渴者，名無有求。
translation: A monk who says there's no thirst is called someone who has no desire.

source_sentence: 此無有求，雖是相違，然作福不動行果亦轉生。
translation: Although this lack of seeking is contradictory, the result of doing what's blessed and immovable will also be produced in the future.
Monks!

source_sentence: 以此因緣，不惟渴緣於有。」
translation: By these causes and conditions, not only will they crave the conditions for existence."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若取緣有、有緣生者，何故不說彼取及有以為集諦？」
translation: If taking depends on existence and existence depends on birth, why aren't they said to take and exist in order to be the truth of arising?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 以渴能作四種業故：一者、於自身境界受中，作貪美縛業；二者、於渴取中作等起業；三者、於行有中作牽引業；四者、於死已後作相續縛業。
translation: It's because thirst creates four kinds of actions: 1) the action of being tied to the beauty of one's own object; 2) the action of equipoise in thirst-acquisition; 3) the action of pulling in coursing existence; and 4) the action of continuous bondage after death.
Therefore, it's only said that thirst is the noble truth of accumulation."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 有生有老有死，何故名色、六入、觸、受等禪磨之相，乃皆顯為老死之名？」
translation: When there's birth, old age, and death, why are such meditative aspects as name-and-form, the six sense-fields, touch, and sensation all expressed as the name old age and death?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 彼所有出生相者，以三苦順縛示現故。」
translation: They have all the appearances of birth because they are manifested by the three bonds of suffering."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!
What kind of suffering does the birth give rise to?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!
The practice of suffering is revealed."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!
What kind of suffering does old age present?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!
It's a sign of the destruction of suffering."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!
What is the purpose of showing the face of death through suffering?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!
Suffering reveals itself."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 所有四種出生之相，與生老死有何差別？」
translation: What is the difference between these four aspects of birth and birth, old age, and death?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 彼四種出生之相，隨次第生，若生隨相似生，彼出生中生相如是，應知。」
translation: Those four kinds of births are produced in sequence, and if they are produced in a similar way, you should know that they are produced in this way."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 出生之相次第而生，當何所似？」
translation: What is it that appears when the marks of birth are produced in sequence?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 彼初下種即當有生，彼次第增長生；彼次第出胎生，彼次第增長生。
translation: Their first lower seed will be birth, and they will grow into birth in turn; their next birth will be out of the womb, and they will grow into birth in turn.

source_sentence: 彼增長已，能得受用世俗生。
translation: After it grows, it'll be able to experience worldly birth.
After this first birth, who else will it be born from?

source_sentence: 眾界入生而無有我，何以故？
translation: Why is there no self when all realms enter birth?

source_sentence: 五眾等增長遷流，以無常故；及命根、力、限量、時、住，亦為無常所生故。
translation: The five aggregates and so forth grow and migrate because they're impermanent, and their life force, strength, duration, timing, and abode are also produced by impermanence.
Monks!

source_sentence: 彼四種出生之相，時分破壞即作五種衰惡，說名為老。」
translation: When those four kinds of birth are destroyed in time, they become five kinds of decay and are said to be old."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!
What are the five evils?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 一者、髮衰惡，髮壞離色故；二者、依衰惡(依謂身也)，肉處色力衰惡故；三者、業衰惡，語時上氣喘息故，住時曲如牛脊曲故，坐時向前重身故，行時按杖故，意智繫縛及念弱少故；四者、受用衰惡，於現在眾具中受用下劣故，於諸遊戲所可憙中皆不受用故，於色根自境界中不速疾行及不行故；五者命根衰惡，壽盡死近，及少緣死不堪忍故。
translation: First, hair deteriorates because it breaks down and leaves form; second, bases deteriorate (bases are the body) because the physical realm's form power deteriorates; third, actions deteriorate because when speaking, upper breath is labored, when standing, it's bent like a cow's back, when sitting, it's a heavy body, when walking, it's a stick, it's a fettered mind, and mindfulness is weak; fourth, enjoyment deteriorates because the enjoyment of the present necessities is inferior, the joys of play are not enjoyed, and the movements of the sense faculties in their own realms are not rapid or effective; fifth, the life faculty deteriorates because life expectancy and death are near, and death with few conditions is intolerable.
Monks!

source_sentence: 於彼四種出生相中，亦有六種死差別應知。
translation: Of those four kinds of births, there are also six kinds of death that should be distinguished.

source_sentence: 一者盡竟死、二者不盡竟死、三者自相死、四者不盡竟死分、五者盡竟死分、六者非時時死。
translation: One is terminal death, two are incomplete deaths, three are self-imposed deaths, four are incomplete deaths, five are terminal deaths, and six are deaths at non-regulation times.
Monks!

source_sentence: 於中自相死者，識於身中移出別分，及色根滅沒，如是應知。
translation: In that case, you should know that when you die on your own, the consciousness moves out of separate parts of the body, and the form faculty disappears.
Monks!

source_sentence: 名色等出生之相與生老死有此差別。」
translation: There's this difference between the marks of birth in terms of name and form and birth through old age and death."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 三種渴愛，皆說緣生與生作因，何故惟說欲界生？」
translation: Of the three kinds of craving, all are said to be conditioned by birth and to be produced as a cause, so why is it only said that the desire realm is produced?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 以欲界生麁故，不可讚歎亦不可教知，以迴還非解脫法體故。」
translation: It's because birth in the desire realm is crude, unpraiseworthy, and unteachable, and because turning back is not the essence of liberation."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若此攝聚緣生及以轉出說十二分，於中幾是能攝聚分，幾是所攝聚分？
translation: If these twelve parts of the teaching are concerned with gathering clusters and producing them by transformation, how many of them are the clusters that gather and how many are the clusters that are gathered?

source_sentence: 幾是能轉出分，幾是所轉出分？」
translation: How many are the parts that are turned out and how many are the parts that are turned out?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 無明與行及一分識，是能攝聚分；彼一分識及名色、六入、觸、受，是所攝聚分。
translation: Nescience and volition, along with a part of consciousness, are the categories that can be collected, and that part of consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense-fields, touch, and sensation are the categories that are collected.
Monks!

source_sentence: 彼一分受及渴愛、取、有，是能轉出分；生、老死是所轉出分，及彼一分名色、六入、觸、受，亦是所轉出分，應知。」
translation: That part of feeling, craving, grasping, and becoming are the factors that are capable of turning out, birth and old age and death are the factors that turn out, and that part of name-and-form, the six sense-fields, touch, and sensation are also the factors that turn out should be known."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 此能攝聚分及此能轉出分，為一時生可見，為當次第？」
translation: Are these factors that can gather clusters and these factors that can turn out visible at one time, and should they come in order?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!
One time it arises, it's explained in order."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 能攝聚分、能轉出分既一時生，何故初說能攝聚分，後說能轉出分？」
translation: Since the factors that collect and the factors that emanate are produced at the same time, why is it that it's said at first that the factors that collect are produced and later that the factors that emanate are produced?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 由所攝聚有更轉出，是故無不由所攝聚。」
translation: From the group that's included there's another group that arises, so there's no group that isn't included."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 無明緣不正思，何故說與無明作緣？」
translation: When the condition of nescience is not correctly considered, why is it said to be a condition of nescience?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 以其無明由不正思牽已與行作緣，從無明生觸、受，及與渴愛作緣。」
translation: Because that ignorance is tethered by incorrect thought, it creates the condition of volition, and from that ignorance comes contact, sensation, and the condition of craving."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!
How many aspects can be understood by briefly explaining dependent arising?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 略說三相緣生可知：一者不動緣生相(泥梨賀翻為不動，而是空義以空故無所動作)，二者無常緣生相，三者堪能緣生相。」
translation: Briefly, we can explain the three aspects of conditioned arising: first, the aspect of immovability as conditioned by arising (which Nirgrantha translates as immovability but means emptiness because it's empty, there's nothing to move), second, the aspect of impermanence as conditioned by arising, and third, the aspect of being able to condition by arising."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 有四種緣，世尊所說，謂因緣、無間緣(舊名次第緣)、攀緣、增上緣(亦名生緣)。
translation: There are four kinds of conditions that the Bhagavān explains, which are causal conditions, indirect conditions (formerly called sequential conditions), climbing conditions, and contributory conditions (also called generative conditions).
Great Teacher!

source_sentence: 於中以何等緣，無明與行作緣？
translation: What are the conditions by which nescience and volition serve as conditions?

source_sentence: 乃至以何等緣，生與老死作緣？」
translation: What are the conditions for making birth and old age the conditions for death?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 諸行轉生同相故，我說四種緣。
translation: Because all conditioned things arise in the same way, I've described four kinds of conditions.

source_sentence: 於此義中惟增上緣，我意說為無明緣行乃至生緣老死。
translation: In this sense, only the contributory conditions, which I mean to describe as the contributory condition of nescience and the contributory condition of volition up to the contributory condition of birth and old age and death.

source_sentence: 彼增上緣，復有不相著及相著。」
translation: Again, those contributory conditions are non-attachment and attachment to marks."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!
What is the superordinate condition of non-attachment?
What are the contributory conditions for attachment?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 未生不正思中無明順眠，與諸行不相著而作緣；若生已即相著。
translation: Ignorance and latency in incorrect deliberation that have yet to arise have no attachment to conditioned practices; if they do arise, they become attached.
Monks!

source_sentence: 其不正思與行和合，於六識身和合共生，生而未滅，與識不相著而作緣；若生滅已即相著。
translation: When incorrect deliberation and practice combine, the six consciousnesses are produced together, and when they are produced but haven't ceased, they form a cognitive attachment without being attached to consciousness; if they are produced and ceased, then they become attached.
Monks!

source_sentence: 所有未到死時之識，與名色不相著而作緣(識與名色相著作緣，梵本亦無此句)，如識於名色，如是攝聚名色於轉出名色亦如是。
translation: "When a consciousness that has not yet reached death is unattached to name-and-form and makes perceptual objects (consciousness and name-and-form are perceptual objects; the Sanskrit text doesn't have this phrase either), as consciousness is in name-and-form, so it is when name-and-form are collected and developed, and so it is when name-and-form are developed.

source_sentence: 如名色於名色，如是六入於六入、觸於觸、受於受，亦如是。
translation: As name-and-form is in name-and-form, so are the six sense-fields in the six sense-fields, touch in touch, and feeling in feeling.

source_sentence: 如無明於行，如是無明於渴愛、渴愛於取、取於有，亦如是。
translation: As nescience is in form, so nescience is in craving, craving is in grasping, and grasping is in being, and so it is.

source_sentence: 如識於名色，名色等於名色等如是，有於生亦如是。
translation: As consciousness is in name-and-form, and as name-and-form are in name-and-form, so too is existence in birth.
Again, monks!

source_sentence: 生中胎藏、童子、少年時，與老死不相著而作緣；若到根熟壽盡時中，相著作緣，應知。」
translation: When you're born as a womb-dweller, a child, or a youth, you're not attached to old age and death as a condition; if you work together as a condition when your faculties are ripe and your life span is up, you should know that."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若世尊曾於共因共緣共由法門之中，因渴愛故說業，於中是何密意？」
translation: If the Bhagavān once explained karma as a result of craving within a dharma-gate of common causes and common conditions, what is the hidden meaning in that?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 有之所攝業者，因渴愛故說，此是密意。」
translation: This is the hidden meaning of the karma that's included in existence and is explained because of craving."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!
By what do we understand it to be?
What do these conditions mean?
By what do we understand this to be?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 安置後生處種子故，因義可見；決定住持彼生轉出故，緣義可見；死已出向生處與生故，由義可見。」
translation: It's the meaning of cause that's evident because the seeds of the place of later birth are placed, the meaning of condition that's evident because they're determined to abide in the place of birth and escape, and the meaning of cause that's evident because the place of birth and birth are produced after death."
The monks said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!
What is the meaning of the phrase 'conditioned by birth'?"
The Buddha said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 各自有緣同聚相續，故此諸分生。」
translation: Each has its own conditions for continuity in the same group, and thus the factors arise."

source_sentence: 緣生初勝分法本經卷上
translation: [The first superior aspect of dependent arising, the first part of the Dharma book, vol. 1]
